meanings.definition: (of a line of verse) Complete in itself, not lacking a syllable at the end.
meanings.sent1: The acatalectic poem flowed smoothly without any missing beats.
meanings.sent2: She admired the acatalectic rhythm of the song, finding it satisfying.
meanings.sent3: The acatalectic verse danced happily on the page, never feeling incomplete.
meanings.sent4: His acatalectic storytelling captivated the audience, leaving them spellbound.
meanings.sent5: The acatalectic melody of the music lingered in her mind long after it ended.

meanings.definition: A line of verse that is complete in itself, not lacking a syllable at the end.
meanings.sent1: The poet crafted an acatalectic that stood out among the rest.
meanings.sent2: In literature class, they discussed the importance of an acatalectic in poetry.
meanings.sent3: The acatalectic in the book seemed to wink at the reader, proud of its perfection.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like an acatalectic, leaving no room for doubt or confusion.
meanings.sent5: The acatalectic in the play resonated with the audience, leaving them in awe.
